_header: As I lay upon a night
Subjects: dialogues, Virgin and Christ; Virgin Mary, dialogue, with Christ; Christ, dialogue, with Virgin Mary; Virgin Mary, lullay songs of
_description: A Dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Infant — thirty-seven quatrains (abab) with refrain ‘Alone in my longyng’ and two-line burden: ‘Lullay lullay la lullay / My dere moder lullay’

CULAdd5943.Transcription:
As y lay on ȝole is nyȝtalone in my lo[ng]yng My
                    þoȝt y sawe a wall sayr syȝta may hir child rokyng
                    lolay

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
As I me lay þis endyres nythAll on my loue
                    lokyng…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines: …And xalt haue in manys blysGoddys owene son
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 72-3.

BLHar2330.First Lines: As I me went þis enderdayAlone on my longyng…
BLHar2330.Last Lines: …I pray ȝow þat ȝe woll me IokeAnd syng sum wat þerto…
BLHar2330.Note: Five quatrains only, the last incomplete, added to leaf at end of manuscript.

NLS18721.First Lines: Als i lay vp on a nithalone in my longging…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…Als i lay þis ȝolis dayAlone in my
                    longgingge
